definition: to hasten/to run/to open up/to gallop
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to criss-cross/to run unhindered across the whole country

sentences.english: The elegant person of great strength and gallops happily the power disposition is quite good.
sentences.chinese: 雅力士和乐骋的动力配置都相当不错。

sentences.english: But considered both's price variance, Xinle gallops is obviously more attractive.
sentences.chinese: 但是考虑到两者的价格差异，新乐骋显然更加诱人。

definition: to run fast/to speed/to gallop/to disseminate/to spread
to unstring a bow/to slacken/to relax/to loosen
variant of 御[yu4]/to drive/to manage/to control
piebald horse/used for 麒[qi2], mythical unicorn
large bird, possibly related to crane or swan (archaic)/mythical monstrous bird, cf Sinbad's roc
auspicious/propitious/good luck/felicity/euphoria/used for 旗, e.g. in 旗袍, long Chinese dress
